header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Family, discussion over recent holiday and plans for the day
header.activity: Mother and daughters catching up over coffee.
header.conv_type: Discussing, explaining, requesting, anecdote telling, making arrangements

body.u: okay so yes come on then how was your holiday? in fact I've got to tell you about grandma as well while you've been away she's hilarious
we're not going to see her because obviously we're gonna be going to the airport
erm but au yeah so auauntie is coming so no so grandma no listen to this at Christmas time she bought a turkey crown
and it said on the label freeze on day of purchase use within the month so she froze it on day of purchase it said use within a month
so she's got it out yesterday to defrost to serve for auntie
er well she doesn't know if it's safe or suitable now your dad said it's fine you can have meat in a freezer for ages said it's fine
so what's grandma doing this morning? what was her first job?
no no she's going to phone Morrisons
to have a conversation to check I don't think she's gonna be happy until like I say she's spoken to Bernard Matthews himself
about how safe the turkey is for human consumption
you know probably you know erm he had another funny turn on Saturday?
in Morrisons again in the morning while they're shopping
she took him home didn't she?

she didn't want the ambulance this time so she took him home in a ta well no she drove him home but then she couldn't get him out the car so the neighbour came over to help her and then the neighbour called an ambulance she goes no please don't
and the ambulance came what did they say?
well they took him in didn't they? and he was there till half past nine at night
well it was a Saturday it was busy well they dunno what's wrong with him again nothing
isn't that like the fourth or fifth time now?
yes but it's always when he's in Morrisons and shopping but why do they keep doing the same thing? why doesn't she leave him at home?
she's agreed she's not taking him to Morrisons anymore then
they came back and the car was on the drive right?
and before they come back in the car they'd had a conversation
this is with with your dad
on the way back from the hospital on the way
back from the hospital with your dad

I was crying erm yeah they'd had a conversation right grandpa was saying grandpa says in the well the c the car or gran no it was grandma the car's on the drive is the car going to be alright on the drive? cos you know they get concerned with
yeah it has to be in the garage
anyway dad said well it's going to be late when we get home we're er going to agree now that the car's gonna be alright on the drive for the night
they said okay we're gonna agree grandma says yes okay that's fine grandpa said yes okay yeah the car's staying on the drive for the night it's fine
anyway they get in two two minutes within getting in grandpa puts his coat back on to go outside
I'm gonna put the car in the garage dad said we agreed that it's safe on the drive anyway
he took his coat off didn't he? and he
took his coat off it was fine yeah okay

erm anyway grandma said oh he'll well he'll probably er be up in the middle of the night to go and put it on in the garage anyway dad left them to it fine he hadn't been up in the middle of the night he'd obviously forgotten all about it but they woke up in the morning grandma rang the insurance company to tell them
that the car had been on the drive and out of the garage
overnight can you imagine being on the end of that call?
and they said apparently what did the guy on the end of the phone say?
the guy on the end of the phone said yes well we'll be getting back to you with some more information about it soon
as if just to say please don't contact us again
go away what are they like?
it's what they do she just calls people
to tell them that the car's been on the drive
it's a hab it's a hobby in the morning
it's something to do isn't it?
it's what she just likes to do
it's because she spends most of the time on the phone to me your dad or and then when all else fails let's bother other people
and the amount of people that she calls
she has to call at least one person a day from from somewhere so yeah it's obviously poor poor Morrisons today with the turkey crown
I wonder if they recorded that
car insurance one that's gonna be one they'll play back in the training this could happen to you
yeah try not to lose it
oh dear how did grandpa's cataracts go?
it hurt more this time which is what nan said when she had her second one done so he said it was painful but he's had it done
but he di he didn't know which eye he was having done did he?
dad said well it's quite easy to tell cos you could just cover one and

he's really bad now but gran
but you know like oh nan was round the other day wasn't she?

she was very happy since the moment she got there to be honest
mm dunno she was just very

oh yeah yeah well it was better still but I think she's
she was chatty at the dinner table

you know hell I said well she actually doesn't make it any easier for herself
she makes it so much worse
if she just I dunno tol like told him straight on a few things like when they bought a pie from and he wanted to know exactly what was in it so they spent the evening deconstructing the pie

there's some mea f there's some

she goes along with him oh I don't know actually oh oh well er we don't know

you know I said they could
have the Attendance Allowance and they should go for this Attendance Allowance?
when he wasn't well did I tell you this ?
to be looked after cos grandpa needs looking after?

but obviously he can't look after himself
but erm but as we've said he's never been able to look after himself his entire life but he he can't he's got the

yeah she wasn't going to give her national insurance number to anyone
I said they're just checking you're not some Polish immigrant that's just arrived
well I'm not telling them that I'm not te
no I'm not telling them that
said well you've got to tell them that and then we told her you haven't gotta disclose any of your assets because it's not a means-tested allowance
you know you're entitled to it just because you know no matter whether you've got a million pounds or ten pounds

so it's not means-tested so I said well you know you should fill it out took a week sort of thinking about it didn't it? and then she did fill it out then she phoned me up and she said oh hello is there? I said erm no he's at work oh well it's not impor well it is important but he hasn't gotta come round right away I said well he can't come round tonight cos he's working late we're going out tomorrow and he's working possibly Sunday
oh no this the anytime next week there's no

there's no rush at all he's very busy I know he does a lot there's no rush at all I'd like him to come over and look over the form I've filled out the form but I would like him to have a quick look before I send it off just to he's much better at these things than me I said okay so I told him and he says oh I says there's no rush well of course twenty-four hours later she phoned
haven't you haven't been round he said well I haven't had a chance yet you told
I told you need to come round and see
well anyway I said just go and sort the form out he was gone hours she'd put yes and no to every question
and he said if there was a maybe she'd've ticked that as well
every single question well sometimes yes sometimes no

he said well she said well er it is yes and it's no
and it depends what day it is and she said I'm not saying I'm a carer if he thinks I'm being paid to care for him he'll insist on me doing even more
dad said but you are a carer

answer the questions correctly and then if she did she just put everything down to it

erm and I said well if you get the Attendance Allowance if you're getting fifty-five pounds a week you can put some of that towards
